page.title: 10DAGLINGWORTH QUARRY.
page.content: The Daglingworth Quarry is about 4 kms from Cirencester on the A417 Gloucester Road. It has been a Quarry since 1935, and covers about 100 acres. The stone is used to build houses, stone walls,for landscaping and to provide support in pipelines. The men blow holes in the ground with explosive every 2 weeks. The stone is then ready for sorting, using screens which are like giant sieves. After going through 3 crushers the stone is like dry sand or dust. The dumper trucks are yellow, their wheels are about .5 metres wide and about 1.5 metres high. The tread on the tyres is very big and gives good grip. Their carrying capacity is 27 tons of stone. The cab window is made of dark plastic which provides good protection for the driver against flying rocks. CONTINUED
